intro: Erica daboecia, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to the western Cape region of South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late summer to early autumn. Erica daboecia is well adapted to harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
